text: Had several issues with the Lenovo Legion Y520 15.6" FHD, Quad-Core i7 7700HQ 2.8GHz, 16GB RAM, 512GB NVMe SSD, 6GB Nvidia GeForce GTX 1060, WIFI & BT, USB C, USB 3.0, HDMI 2.0, Harman Audio, Windows 10 Pro 7th Gen Gaming Laptop since day one. performance throttles under load and the keyboard feels cheap. Performance in competitive gaming is not as advertised. Regret this purchase.

Quite disappointed with this laptop, the Lenovo Legion Y520 15.6" FHD, Quad-Core i7 7700HQ 2.8GHz, 16GB RAM, 512GB NVMe SSD, 6GB Nvidia GeForce GTX 1060, WIFI & BT, USB C, USB 3.0, HDMI 2.0, Harman Audio, Windows 10 Pro 7th Gen Gaming Laptop. It overheats frequently when playing Apex Legends, and the performance throttles significantly. The port selection has been a letdown. Wouldn't recommend.

Had several issues with the Lenovo Legion Y520 15.6" FHD, Quad-Core i7 7700HQ 2.8GHz, 16GB RAM, 512GB NVMe SSD, 6GB Nvidia GeForce GTX 1060, WIFI & BT, USB C, USB 3.0, HDMI 2.0, Harman Audio, Windows 10 Pro 7th Gen Gaming Laptop since day one. blue screens occasionally and the battery life feels cheap. Performance in AAA gaming is not as advertised. Regret this purchase.

Had several issues with the Lenovo Legion Y520 15.6" FHD, Quad-Core i7 7700HQ 2.8GHz, 16GB RAM, 512GB NVMe SSD, 6GB Nvidia GeForce GTX 1060, WIFI & BT, USB C, USB 3.0, HDMI 2.0, Harman Audio, Windows 10 Pro 7th Gen Gaming Laptop since day one. Wi-Fi drops intermittently and the screen brightness feels cheap. Performance in content creation and gaming is not as advertised. Regret this purchase.
